title: FlowCode Spectral Flow Unmixing Workflow
text: need AutoSpectral FlowCodeUnmix run . first time using , run installation code , take care everything .
code: # Install Bioconductor packages if (!requireNamespace("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE))   install.packages("BiocManager") BiocManager::install(c("flowWorkspace", "flowCore", "PeacoQC", "FlowSOM"))  # Install any missing CRAN packages that we'll need cran.packages <- c(   "shiny",   "shinyFiles",   "ggplot2",   "scattermore",   "dplyr" )  missing.pkgs <- setdiff(   cran.packages,   rownames(installed.packages()) )  if (length(missing.pkgs) > 0) {   install.packages(missing.pkgs, dependencies = TRUE) }  # install `remotes` to allow you to install GitHub packages (devtools also works) install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("DrCytometer/AutoSpectral") remotes::install_github("DrCytometer/FlowCodeUnmix")

title: FlowCode Spectral Flow Unmixing Workflow
text: start spectral flow cytometry data set AutoSpectral. load cytometer-specific parameters, load single-stained control FCS data, clean-control data, extract spectral profiles fluorophores, identify autofluorescence signatures measure spectral variation fluorophore output.

title: FlowCode Spectral Flow Unmixing Workflow
text: using data Cytek Aurora (5-laser system). data different spectral cytometer, call appropriate cytometer “cytometer”. details AutoSpectral workflow, see AutoSpectral help.
code: library(AutoSpectral) autospectral.parameters <- AutoSpectral::get.autospectral.param(   cytometer = "aurora",   figure = TRUE )

what: Create and check the control file
title: FlowCode Spectral Flow Unmixing Workflow
text: control file CSV file (spreadsheet) describes control files AutoSpectral. draft created automatically AutoSpectral tell single-stained control files . need edit check sure correct. Details article. also Shiny helper application , opens interactive webpage. edited control file, check :
code: # where are your single-stained control files? # replace the "my_control_folder" with the path to your files. # Tip: if you start RStudio by double-clicking on this or another R document, # that tells RStudio where you want to work. If you place a folder (say, called SSC) # containing your control fcs files in that folder, you will be able to access  # it with just "./SSC control.folder <- "C://User/Documents/my_control_folder"  # or control.folder <- "./SSC"  AutoSpectral::create.control.file(   control.dir = control.folder,   asp = autospectral.parameters ) control.file <- "fcs_control_file.csv" AutoSpectral::check.control.file(   control.dir = control.folder,   control.def.file = control.file,   asp = autospectral.parameters )

title: FlowCode Spectral Flow Unmixing Workflow
text: step likely take minutes. AutoSpectral now take information control file, read single-stained FCS files, determine gates use extract information gates downstream usage. can go faster setting parallel = TRUE. Check plots folder figure_gate sure gating working appropriately samples. See help pages look good.
code: flow.control <- AutoSpectral::define.flow.control(   control.dir = control.folder,   control.def.file = control.file,   asp = autospectral.parameters,   parallel = FALSE )

title: FlowCode Spectral Flow Unmixing Workflow
text: also take minutes, likely. step, trying identify useful events single-stained controls determining fluorophore spectra. involves removing cells (cell-based controls) interfere measurement (e.g., autofluorescent macrophages dead cells), selecting brightest events matching background events unstained sample.
code: cleaned.controls <- AutoSpectral::clean.controls(   flow.control = flow.control,   asp = autospectral.parameters )

title: FlowCode Spectral Flow Unmixing Workflow
text: Now extract fluorophore spectral information cleaned data. relatively quick. Plots appear figure_spectra figure_similarity_heatmap.
code: fluorophore.spectra <- AutoSpectral::get.fluorophore.spectra(   flow.control = cleaned.controls,   asp = autospectral.parameters,   use.clean.expr = TRUE )

title: FlowCode Spectral Flow Unmixing Workflow
text: Autofluorescence always present stained cells, including single-stained cell controls. source variability contributes noise (spread) unmixed data. need identify variability autofluorescence counteract . FlowCode data, often different tissue sources, distinct distribution autofluorescence profiles. eventually need identify . start, though, identify variability type sample using single-stained controls. instance, mouse studies, likely splenocytes, use unstained spleen source autofluorescence. example, unstained spleen sample “Unstained” (named SpectroFlo) reference control group. FCS file single-stained control folder, along controls.
code: spleen.autofluorescence <- AutoSpectral::get.af.spectra(   unstained.sample = file.path( control.folder, "Unstained.fcs" ),   asp = autospectral.parameters,   spectra = fluorophore.spectra )

what: Determine spectral variation in the fluorophores
title: FlowCode Spectral Flow Unmixing Workflow
text: Now know contribution autofluorescence variation, can extract variation fluorophore emissions . end normal AutoSpectral workflow us. now need FlowCode-specific steps proceeding debarcoding unmixing.
code: fluorophore.variation <- AutoSpectral::get.spectral.variants(   control.dir = control.folder,   control.def.file = control.file,   asp = autospectral.parameters,   spectra = fluorophore.spectra,   af.spectra = spleen.autofluorescence,   parallel = FALSE )

title: FlowCode Spectral Flow Unmixing Workflow
text: FlowCode workflow, need additional pieces information: * FlowCode epitope tag channels? * valid FlowCode combinations (combination file)? * name (guide/TCR) combination (combination file)? * cells (user-drawn gate)? * variation fluorophore output created combinations due FRET FRET-like artifact? , need backbone control, stained FlowCode epitope antibodies. combinations well represented best results.

title: FlowCode Spectral Flow Unmixing Workflow
text: Provide location (file path) name backbone FCS file. Provide name (file path) combination CSV file. Now can unmix backbone control, using slight adaptation AutoSpectral unmixing approach. spleen-based sample, use spleen.autofluorescence. saves output RDS file folder specified output.dir. change output.dir, ’ll need change later get.flowcode.spectra(). *Note: change returning object
code: flowcode.backbone <- "./Raw/FC control (Spleen)/F2 FC_FRET_02_Plate_002.fcs"  combo.file <- "OTB01 Treg Tx factor combinations.csv" FlowCodeUnmix::unmix.backbone(    flowcode.backbone.fcs = flowcode.backbone,    spectra = fluorophore.spectra,    af.spectra = spleen.autofluorescence,    flow.control = cleaned.controls,    asp = autospectral.parameters,    flowcode.combo.file = combo.file,    output.dir = "./flowcode_spectra",    filename = "FlowCode_Backbone.rds" )

title: FlowCode Spectral Flow Unmixing Workflow
text: part requires manually select point graph data start becoming “positive” FlowCode epitope tags. , threshold FlowCode ? manual ’s pretty hard well automated manner considering stage still FRET-based unmixing issues. created Shiny app allow interactively, Orian Bricard’s FlowCode debarcoding app. ’re done, CSV file (spreadsheet), pretty simple just contains numerical value corresponding threshold FlowCode channel.
code: FlowCodeUnmix::launch.threshold.app()

what: Measuring FRET (unmixing) errors due to FlowCodes
title: FlowCode Spectral Flow Unmixing Workflow
text: step, take FlowCode epitope-stained backbone data (unmixed data RDS file), debarcode identify valid combinations, assess spectral unmixing errors per combination. gives us set potential corrections apply cell given barcode combination. call saves output RDS file folder specified output.dir. select plot.corrections = TRUE, identify FRET errors cell--cell basis, correct , plot examples FlowCode epitope unmixing looks like backbone file without corrections. can bit slow, definitely worth first couple times.
code: flowcode.spectra <- FlowCodeUnmix::get.flowcode.spectra(   backbone.rds = "./flowcode_spectra/FlowCode_Backbone.rds",   thresholds.file = "./flowcode_spectra/thresholds.csv",   output.dir = "./flowcode_spectra",   filename = "FlowCode_Spectra.rds",   plot.corrections = TRUE )

title: FlowCode Spectral Flow Unmixing Workflow
text: now data required unmixing, , least files coming spleen. ’ll get tissue sources second. unmix single file, call unmix.flowcode.fcs(). unmix folder containing many files, call unmix.flowcode.folder(). want look tissues sources, samples autofluorescence may differ autofluorescence profiles already extracted, first need call AutoSpectral::get.af.spectra() unstained samples representing autofluorescence sources. can unmix samples tissues, extracting matching autofluorescence correctly. many cases, thresholds positivity may vary slightly tissue type sample source. case, need provide new thresholds part unmixing process. start, unmix single FCS file source want use set new thresholds. unmixing AutoSpectral, extracting AF per cell, since get closer data look like FlowCodeUnmix. load file ThresholdApp, select new thresholds FlowCode marker, save results (can rename CSV file). Now provide new CSV file containing updated thresholds unmixing. suspect cases little need re-thresholding different tissues. may need re-threshold fully stained sample, though, since differ backbone control used establish first set thresholds.
code: # for example: fully.stained.spleen <- "./Raw/Spleen/Spleen_Mouse_001.fcs"  # then call: FlowCodeUnmix::unmix.flowcode.fcs(   fcs.file = fully.stained.spleen,   spectra = fluorophore.spectra,   asp = autospectral.parameters,   flow.control = cleaned.controls,   af.spectra = spleen.autofluorescence,   spectra.variants = fluorophore.variation,   flowcode.spectra = flowcode.spectra,   k = 10, # use k = 1 for fastest unmixing, k = 10 (default) for slower but better, k ~ 3 compromise   parallel = TRUE ) # for example: spleen.folder <- "./Raw/Spleen/"  # then call: FlowCodeUnmix::unmix.flowcode.folder(   sample.dir = spleen.folder,   spectra = fluorophore.spectra,   asp = autospectral.parameters,   flow.control = cleaned.controls,   af.spectra = spleen.autofluorescence,   spectra.variants = fluorophore.variation,   flowcode.spectra = "./flowcode_spectra/FlowCode_Spectra.rds",   parallel = TRUE ) # Let's say we have brain samples  # this is our unstained brain sample (raw data) unstained.brain <- "./Raw/Unstained controls/Unstained brain.fcs"  # we extract the AF profiles from it brain.autofluorescence <- AutoSpectral::get.af.spectra(   unstained.sample = unstained.brain,   asp = autospectral.parameters,   spectra = fluorophore.spectra )  # now we want the raw data for the fully stained brain sample fully.stained.brain <- "./Raw/Brain/Brain_Mouse_001.fcs"  # then call to unmix: FlowCodeUnmix::unmix.flowcode.fcs(   fcs.file = fully.stained.brain, # change the sample   spectra = fluorophore.spectra,   asp = autospectral.parameters,   flow.control = cleaned.controls,   af.spectra = brain.autofluorescence, # change the autofluorescence to match   spectra.variants = fluorophore.variation,   flowcode.spectra = "./flowcode_spectra/FlowCode_Spectra.rds",   parallel = TRUE ) # this is our unstained brain sample (raw data) unstained.brain <- "./Raw/Unstained controls/Unstained brain.fcs"  # we extract the AF profiles from it brain.autofluorescence <- AutoSpectral::get.af.spectra(   unstained.sample = unstained.brain,   asp = autospectral.parameters,   spectra = fluorophore.spectra )  # now we want the raw data for the fully stained brain sample fully.stained.brain <- "./Raw/Brain/Brain_Mouse_001.fcs"   launch.threshold.app(   flowcode.combo.file = combo.file,   flow.control = cleaned.controls,   spectra = fluorophore.spectra )  new.thresholds <- "./flowcode_spectra/New_thresholds.csv"  # then call to unmix: FlowCodeUnmix::unmix.flowcode.fcs(   fcs.file = fully.stained.brain, # change the sample   spectra = fluorophore.spectra,   asp = autospectral.parameters,   flow.control = cleaned.controls,   af.spectra = brain.autofluorescence, # change the autofluorescence to match   spectra.variants = fluorophore.variation,   flowcode.spectra = "./flowcode_spectra/FlowCode_Spectra.rds",   thresholds.file = new.thresholds, # specify new thresholds   parallel = TRUE )

title: FlowCode Spectral Flow Unmixing Workflow
text: new unmixing, resulting FCS files already debarcoded. inspect files R FlowJo, see channel tags (names, guides, TCRs) linked FlowCode combination. expression channels expression combination FlowCode epitopes cells. Additionally, “FlowCode” channel, expression level epiopes cells valid FlowCode combinations. words, “FlowCode” channel measures transduction. , FlowJo, can gate cells plot tag combo versus whatever markers flow panel. useful checking CRISPR guide efficiency (example, plotting GATA-3 expression Gata3-targeted cells) phenotyping. want, can run dimensionality reduction clustering approaches FlowJo, R Python FCS files pre-gating. analyses, recommend pre-gating specific biologically relevant cell populations. still need write part R. present, able treat unmixed FCS files get workflow previously, running Orian Bricard’s FlowCodeDecoder. difference unmixing now correct (hopefully), barcodes phenotyping gating markers.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Oliver Burton. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Burton O (2026). FlowCodeUnmix: Tools Unmixing FlowCode Spectral Cytometry Data. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/DrCytometer/FlowCodeUnmix.
code: @Manual{,   title = {FlowCodeUnmix: Tools for Unmixing FlowCode Spectral Cytometry Data},   author = {Oliver Burton},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/DrCytometer/FlowCodeUnmix}, }

what: Tools for Unmixing FlowCode Spectral Cytometry Data
title: Tools for Unmixing FlowCode Spectral Cytometry Data
text: FlowCodeUnmix intended complete debarcoding unmixing pipeline spectral flow cytometry samples using FlowCode protein epitope barcoding technology. Thi FlowCodeUnmix provided AGPL3 licence. read FlowCodes see Immunity paper Bricard et al. also ProCode system upon FlowCodes based.

title: Tools for Unmixing FlowCode Spectral Cytometry Data
text: need install following packages: BiocManager flowCore FlowSOM flowWorkspace remotes (devtools) AutoSpectral Everything else installed automatically. Run code machine set everything .
code: # Install Bioconductor packages if (!requireNamespace("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE))   install.packages("BiocManager") BiocManager::install(c("flowWorkspace", "flowCore", "FlowSOM", "remotes"))  # You'll need devtools or remotes to install from GitHub. remotes::install_github("DrCytometer/AutoSpectral") remotes::install_github("DrCytometer/FlowCodeUnmix")

title: Tools for Unmixing FlowCode Spectral Cytometry Data
text: need pieces information: Single-stained control samples, preferably cell-based “backbone”” control sample stained anti-epitope antibodies (nothing else) Unstained control cells matching source used backbone control Unstained control cells matching source(s) fully stained samples CSV file describing valid combinations epitope barcodes correspond . Example format :

title: Tools for Unmixing FlowCode Spectral Cytometry Data
text: FlowCodeUnmix based around AutoSpectral. Please see help pages articles AutoSpectral starting point. particular, see AutoSpectral Full Workflow. FlowCodeUnmix, see example workflow “FlowCode_Unmixing_Workflow.Rmd”, also available web FlowCode Workflow. can view functions available FlowCodeUnmix .

title: Check RDS Contents — check.rds.contents
text: Checks RDS file expected elements.

title: Check RDS Contents — check.rds.contents
code: check.rds.contents(obj, required = list(), allow.extra = TRUE)

title: Check RDS Contents — check.rds.contents
text: obj loaded RDS object. required List required elements. allow.extra Logical, whether allow additional, unexpected elements. Default TRUE.

title: Check RDS Contents — check.rds.contents
text: Returns errors found; otherwise, returns TRUE.

title: Create Parallel Lapply — create.parallel.lapply
text: Sets parallel processing lapply function Windows, Mac OS Linux.

title: Create Parallel Lapply — create.parallel.lapply
code: create.parallel.lapply(   asp,   exports,   parallel = TRUE,   threads = NULL,   export.env = parent.frame(),   dev.mode = FALSE,   package.path = NULL,   allow.mclapply.mac = FALSE )

title: Create Parallel Lapply — create.parallel.lapply
text: asp AutoSpectral parameter list. exports vector variables functions pass clusters. parallel Logical, controls whether parallel processing used. Default TRUE. threads Numeric, number threads use parallel processing. Default NULL revert asp$worker.process.n parallel=TRUE. export.env environment containing functions global variables potentially needed clusters. Default parent.frame(). dev.mode Logical, allows testing function development. Default FALSE. package.path File.path R package files AutoSpectral permit loading functions via devtools::load_all() dev.mode. Default NULL. allow.mclapply.mac Logical, TRUE permits mclapply() forking Mac OS. Default FALSE forces PSOCK cluster use Mac prevent multithreaded Accelerate BLAS crashing parallels matrix ops used.

title: Create Parallel Lapply — create.parallel.lapply
text: lapply function, either based parLapply Windows mcLapply Mac OS Linux. parallel backend initialization fails, sequential lapply returned.

title: Debarcode — debarcode
text: Debarcodes FlowCode data, identifying valid invalid combinations.

title: Debarcode — debarcode
code: debarcode(unmixed, flowcode.fluors, flowcode.thresholds, combo.df)

title: Debarcode — debarcode
text: unmixed Matrix unmixed flow cytometry expression data. Cells rows fluorophores columns. Fluorophores must include flowcode.fluors. flowcode.fluors Named character vector fluorophores used identify FlowCodes. Names FlowCode epitope tags, values corresponding fluorophores. flowcode.thresholds Named numeric vector thresholds cell (event) may considered positive given FlowCode. Names fluorophores, values threshold raw, untransformed unmixed scale. combo.df Data frame describing valid combinations FlowCodes. Structure: One row per combination. Columns Id, Procode.tag1, Procode.tag2 Procode.tag3, describing name (e.g., CRISPR target), three epitopes combination, respectively.

title: Debarcode — debarcode
text: numeric vector, length nrow(unmixed), linking event Id combo.df row number.

title: Define Gate — define.gate
text: Defines gate boundary forward (FSC) side (SSC) scatter parameters. selecting brightest events FlowCode tag fluorescence channels, determining location scatter, defining density/distance- based region around centroid events. aim focus scatter region highest signal, without additional inputs prior knowledge, means determining cells . important identifying positive events correctly, also critical matching background noise/autofluorescence/non-specific staining level similar events (cells rather debris).

title: Define Gate — define.gate
code: define.gate(scatter.data, unmixed.data, flowcode.fluors, asp, n.cells = 200)

title: Define Gate — define.gate
text: scatter.data Matrix FSC SSC data corresponding events unmixed.data. Used define scatter gating region. unmixed.data Matrix unmixed flow cytometry expression data. Cells rows fluorophores columns. Fluorophores must include flowcode.fluors. flowcode.fluors Named character vector fluorophores used identify FlowCodes. Names FlowCode epitope tags, values corresponding fluorophores. asp AutoSpectral parameter list. n.cells Numeric, default 200. Number brightest events per channel use defining gate region.

title: Define Gate — define.gate
text: Gate boundary

title: FlowCode Combo Plot — flowcode.combo.plot
text: Creates side--side pseudocolor density dot plots (standard flow cytometry) FlowCode markers. Plots unmixed data biexponential scale using AutoSpectral::create.biplot().

title: FlowCode Combo Plot — flowcode.combo.plot
code: flowcode.combo.plot(   unmixed,   corrected,   flowcode.fluors,   asp,   output.dir = "./flowcode_spectra",   filename = "Corrected_biplots.jpg",   width = 5,   height = 10 )

title: FlowCode Combo Plot — flowcode.combo.plot
text: unmixed Matrix unmixed flow cytometry expression data. Cells rows fluorophores columns. Fluorophores must include flowcode.fluors. corrected Corrected matrix unmixed flow cytometry expression data processing FRET errors. flowcode.fluors Named character vector fluorophores used identify FlowCodes. Names FlowCode epitope tags, values corresponding fluorophores. asp AutoSpectral parameter list. Prepare using get.autospectral.param. output.dir File path determining plot saved. Default ./flowcode_spectra. filename Character, name saved plot. Default Corrected_biplots.jpg. width Numeric, default 10. Width (inches) saved plot. height Numeric, default 5. Height (inches) saved plot.

title: FlowCode Combo Plot — flowcode.combo.plot
text: None. Saves plot specified file path output.dir.

title: Get FlowCode Spectra — get.flowcode.spectra
text: Measure spectral unmixing errors per barcode sample stained FlowCode tag antibodies (flowcode.backbone.fcs). Measures FRET error returns calculated correction matrices thresholds debarcoding.

title: Get FlowCode Spectra — get.flowcode.spectra
code: get.flowcode.spectra(   backbone.rds,   thresholds.file,   asp,   output.dir = "./flowcode_spectra",   filename = "FlowCode_Spectra.rds",   figures = TRUE,   plot.corrections = TRUE,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Get FlowCode Spectra — get.flowcode.spectra
text: backbone.rds File name path full (large) rds file produced running unmix.backbone. work well, combinations present experimental samples well represented backbone sample used. thresholds.file File name path thresholds CSV file produced using threshold setting app. asp AutoSpectral parameter list. Prepare using get.autospectral.param. output.dir Destination folder output plots saved spectra. Default ./flowcode_spectra. filename Logical, whether create save plots data correction. Default TRUE. figures Logical, controls whether graphs process produced. Default TRUE. plot.corrections Logical, default FALSE. TRUE, FRET unmixing applied flowcode.backbone.fcs plots corrected data (FlowCode channels ) produced output.dir. verbose Logical, default TRUE. Set FALSE suppress messaging.

title: Get FlowCode Spectra — get.flowcode.spectra
text: named list two elements: Thresholds: numeric thresholds debarcoding FRET: list matrices FRET spectral variations per barcode combo Flowcode.fluors: Character vector fluorophores linked FlowCodes Combos: valid combinations, specified combination file.

what: Launch the Thresholding Shiny App — launch.threshold.app
title: Launch the Thresholding Shiny App — launch.threshold.app
text: simple wrapper function launch manual threshold selection app.

title: Launch the Thresholding Shiny App — launch.threshold.app
code: launch.threshold.app(   flowcode.combo.file = NULL,   flow.control = NULL,   spectra = NULL )

title: Launch the Thresholding Shiny App — launch.threshold.app
text: flowcode.combo.file Optional, default NULL. Provide wish establish new thresholds using app working FCS file rather loading RDS object. given: File name path CSV file containing information describing FlowCode library. Describes valid combinations FlowCodes. Structure: One row per combination. Columns Id, Procode.tag1, Procode.tag2 Procode.tag3, describing name (e.g., CRISPR target), three epitopes combination, respectively. flow.control Optional, default NULL. Provide wish establish new thresholds using app working FCS file rather loading RDS object. list containing flow cytometry control parameters. spectra Optional, default NULL. Provide wish establish new thresholds using app working FCS file rather loading RDS object.Spectral signatures fluorophores, normalized 0 1, fluorophores rows detectors columns.

title: Parallel Backend — parallel.backend
text: Sets parallel processing backend using parallel parallelly establish PSOCK clusters Windows. Sets clusters, defines parLapply-based function.

title: Parallel Backend — parallel.backend
code: parallel.backend(   asp,   exports,   threads,   export.env = parent.frame(),   dev.mode = FALSE,   package.path = NULL )

title: Parallel Backend — parallel.backend
text: asp AutoSpectral parameter list. exports vector variables functions pass clusters. threads Numeric, number threads use parallel processing. export.env environment containing functions global variables potentially needed clusters. dev.mode Logical, allows testing function development. Default FALSE. package.path File.path R package files AutoSpectral permit loading functions via devtools::load_all() dev.mode.

title: Parallel Backend — parallel.backend
text: lapply function, either based parLapply parallel backend initialization successful using sequential lapply .

title: Plot Tag Expression — tag.expression.plot
text: Creates ridgeline (density) plots FlowCode fluorophore expression levels unmixed data.

title: Plot Tag Expression — tag.expression.plot
code: tag.expression.plot(   unmixed,   flowcode.fluors,   flowcode.ids,   combo.df,   asp,   output.dir = "./flowcode_spectra",   title = "Uncorrected",   max.per.group = 2000,   height = 20,   width = 20 )

title: Plot Tag Expression — tag.expression.plot
text: unmixed Matrix unmixed flow cytometry expression data. Cells rows fluorophores columns. Fluorophores must include flowcode.fluors. flowcode.fluors Named character vector fluorophores used identify FlowCodes. Names FlowCode epitope tags, values corresponding fluorophores. flowcode.ids Numeric vector containing FlowCode combination assignments per cell (result debarcode()). combo.df Data frame describing valid combinations FlowCodes. Structure: One row per combination. Columns Id, Procode.tag1, Procode.tag2 Procode.tag3, describing name (e.g., CRISPR target), three epitopes combination, respectively. asp AutoSpectral parameter list. output.dir File path determining plot saved. Default ./flowcode_spectra. title Character, name add saved plots. Default Uncorrected. max.per.group Numeric, maximum number cells plot per group (FlowCode combination). Larger numbers take longer. Default 2000. height Numeric, default 20. Width (inches) saved plot. width Numeric, default 20. Height (inches) saved plot.

title: Plot Tag Expression — tag.expression.plot
text: None. Saves plot specified file path output.dir.

title: Unmix Backbone — unmix.backbone
text: Unmix backbone sample, stained anti-FlowCode epitope antibodies, downstream identification FRET/unmixing errors per-combo basis.

title: Unmix Backbone — unmix.backbone
code: unmix.backbone(   flowcode.backbone.fcs,   spectra,   af.spectra,   flow.control,   asp,   flowcode.combo.file,   n.cells.gate = 100,   output.dir = "./flowcode_spectra",   filename = "FlowCode_Backbone.rds",   verbose = TRUE )

title: Unmix Backbone — unmix.backbone
text: flowcode.backbone.fcs File name path FlowCode backbone control FCS file. sample cells, ideally cell source single-stained control samples. cells stained FlowCode epitope tag antibodies present fully stained sample nothing else. tag combinations present well represented best results. minimum 100 cells per combination recommended; 2000+ ideal. spectra Spectral signatures fluorophores, normalized 0 1, fluorophores rows detectors columns. af.spectra Spectral signatures autofluorescences, normalized 0 1, fluorophores rows detectors columns. Prepare using get.af.spectra. flow.control list containing flow cytometry control parameters. asp AutoSpectral parameter list. Prepare using get.autospectral.param. flowcode.combo.file File name path CSV file containing information describing FlowCode library. Describes valid combinations FlowCodes. Structure: One row per combination. Columns Id, Procode.tag1, Procode.tag2 Procode.tag3, describing name (e.g., CRISPR target), three epitopes combination, respectively. n.cells.gate Numeric, default 100. number cells used define gate. gate region defined using define.gate() around brightest n.cells.gate fluorophore used identify FlowCode epitope tags. Scatter coordinates brightest events combined determine optimal gating region. output.dir Destination folder output plots saved spectra. Default ./flowcode_spectra. filename Name output RDS file, default FlowCode_Backbone.rds. verbose Logical, whether send messages console. Default TRUE.

title: Unmix Backbone — unmix.backbone
text: None. Saves RDS objects containing processed data disk.

title: Unmix FlowCode FCS Data — unmix.flowcode.fcs
text: function performs spectral unmixing FCS data FlowCode samples.

title: Unmix FlowCode FCS Data — unmix.flowcode.fcs
code: unmix.flowcode.fcs(   fcs.file,   spectra,   asp,   flow.control,   af.spectra,   spectra.variants,   flowcode.spectra,   thresholds.file = NULL,   weights = NULL,   cell.weighting = FALSE,   cell.weight.regularize = TRUE,   k = 10,   output.dir = NULL,   file.suffix = NULL,   include.imaging = FALSE,   parallel = TRUE,   threads = if (parallel) 0 else 1,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Unmix FlowCode FCS Data — unmix.flowcode.fcs
text: fcs.file character string specifying path FCS file. spectra matrix containing spectral data. asp AutoSpectral parameter list. Prepare using get.autospectral.param flow.control list containing flow cytometry control parameters. af.spectra Spectral signatures autofluorescences, normalized 0 1, fluorophores rows detectors columns. Prepare using get.af.spectra. Required AutoSpectral unmixing. Default NULL thus provoke failure spectra provided AutoSpectral selected. spectra.variants Named list (names fluorophores) carrying matrices spectral signature variations fluorophore. Prepare using get.spectral.variants. flowcode.spectra Structured output get.flowcode.spectra(), details combination-level spectral unmixing errors due FRET-like artefacts. thresholds.file Optional, file name path thresholds CSV file produced using threshold setting app. Thresholds provided default part flowcode.spectra, selected FlowCode backbone sample. thresholds positivity fluorophores used identify FlowCodes differs fully stained samples unmixed , provide new set thresholds ThresholdApp. Run unmixed sample (OLS instrument fine), refer new thresholds file . Default NULL, ignored. weights Optional numeric vector weights (one per fluorescent detector). Default NULL, case weighting done channel means (Poisson variance). cell.weighting Logical, whether use cell-specific weighting Poisson-like unmixing. Default FALSE. cell.weight.regularize Logical, whether regularize cell-specific weights towards bulk mean weighting set weights. 50:50 averaging. Default TRUE. active cell.weighting=TRUE. k Numeric, controls number variants tested fluorophore, autofluorescence FRET spectrum. Default 10. Values 10 provide additional benefit unmixing quality, 1 fastest. output.dir character string specifying directory save unmixed FCS file. Default NULL, reverts asp$unmixed.fcs.dir. file.suffix character string append output file name. Default NULL. include.imaging logical value indicating whether include imaging parameters written FCS file. Default FALSE. parallel Logical, default TRUE, enables parallel processing per-cell unmixing methods. threads Numeric, default NULL, case asp$worker.process.n used. asp$worker.process.n set default one less available cores machine. Multi-threading used parallel TRUE. verbose Logical, whether send messages console. Default TRUE.

title: Unmix FlowCode FCS Data — unmix.flowcode.fcs
text: None. function writes unmixed FCS data file.

title: Unmix FlowCode — unmix.flowcode
text: Unmix FlowCode samples, correcting FRET errors debarcoding data.

title: Unmix FlowCode — unmix.flowcode
code: unmix.flowcode(   raw.data,   spectra,   af.spectra,   spectra.variants,   flowcode.spectra,   asp,   thresholds = NULL,   weights = NULL,   cell.weighting = FALSE,   cell.weight.regularize = TRUE,   k = 1,   parallel = TRUE,   threads = if (parallel) 0 else 1,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Unmix FlowCode — unmix.flowcode
text: raw.data Expression data raw FCS files. Cells rows detectors columns. Columns fluorescent data must match columns spectra. spectra Spectral signatures fluorophores, normalized 0 1, fluorophores rows detectors columns. af.spectra Spectral signatures autofluorescences, normalized 0 1, fluorophores rows detectors columns. Prepare using get.af.spectra. spectra.variants Named list (names fluorophores) carrying matrices spectral signature variations fluorophore. Prepare using get.spectral.variants(). Default NULL. flowcode.spectra Structured output get.flowcode.spectra(), details combination-level spectral unmixing errors due FRET-like artefacts. asp AutoSpectral parameter list. Prepare using get.autospectral.param. thresholds Optional named numeric vector positivity thresholds FlowCode fluorophores. Overrides thresholds provided flowcode.spectra. Default NULL, unused. weights Optional numeric vector weights (one per fluorescent detector). Default NULL, case weighting done channel means (Poisson variance). cell.weighting Logical, whether use cell-specific weighting Poisson-like unmixing. Default FALSE. cell.weight.regularize Logical, whether regularize cell-specific weights towards bulk mean weighting set weights. 50:50 averaging. Default TRUE. active cell.weighting=TRUE. k Numeric, controls number variants tested fluorophore, autofluorescence FRET spectrum. Default 1, fastest. Values 10 provide additional benefit unmixing quality. parallel Logical, whether use parallel processing per-cell unmixing. Default FALSE. threads Numeric. Number threads use parallel processing. Defaults 1 sequential processing, 0 (cores) parallel=TRUE. verbose Logical, whether send messages console. Default TRUE.

title: Unmix FlowCode — unmix.flowcode
text: Unmixed data cells rows fluorophores columns.

text: raw.data Expression data raw FCS files. Cells rows detectors columns. Prepare using get.af.spectra. spectra.variants Named list (names fluorophores) carrying matrices spectral signature variations fluorophore. Prepare using get.spectral.variants(). Default NULL. flowcode.spectra Structured output get.flowcode.spectra(), details combination-level spectral unmixing errors due FRET-like artefacts. asp description weights Optional numeric vector weights (one per fluorescent detector). Default FALSE. cell.weight.regularize Logical, whether regularize cell-specific weights towards bulk mean weighting set weights. 50:50 averaging. Default FALSE. k Numeric, controls number variants tested fluorophore, autofluorescence FRET spectrum. Default 1, fastest.
